assessments.status_rationale: Today’s items include general market/rotation coverage but no clear evidence that Alphabet has exceeded Apple’s market cap for 10 consecutive U.S. trading sessions, nor any definitive market-cap comparison over a 10-session window.
No bullet cites Reuters/Bloomberg/FT/WSJ/CNBC reporting that Anthropic closed a funding round of at least $7.5B at a $250B+ post-money valuation.
Nothing in today’s bullets indicates Apple issued an Apple Card customer notice or updated terms explicitly naming JPMorgan Chase as issuer/servicer replacing Goldman Sachs.

No evidence in today’s bullets that HHS OCR has opened an investigation, issued a notice, or announced a compliance action explicitly referencing OpenAI’s ChatGPT Health or a consumer health-record integration.
Today’s bullets do not mention Character.AI or any rollout of ID verification or selfie/biometric age estimation as a product-default age-assurance control.
No bullet indicates a new bill introduced in either chamber restricting single-family home purchases by large institutional investors with a 50+ homes (or similar) threshold.

While there is coverage of proposed large military spending and defense-stock moves, nothing indicates DoD issued a formal written policy (memo/DFARS proposed rule/contract clause guidance) tying contracting eligibility or evaluation to limits on dividends or buybacks.
Today’s items note an upcoming jobs report but do not provide a BLS JOLTS release showing job openings below 7.5 million.
No bullet reports a federal announcement (EPA/FEMA/HHS-CDC/HUD) of a competitive grant program totaling $500M+ focused on wildfire-smoke exposure mitigation.
